CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The device configuration was ITO / PEDOT : PSS ( 30 nm ) / polymer : acceptor ( 80 nm ) / LiF(0.7 nm ) / Al(100 nm ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO (Indium Tin Oxide) |
| PEDOT : PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)) |
| polymer : acceptor |
| LiF (Lithium Fluoride) |
| Al (Aluminum) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO (Indium Tin Oxide) |
| PEDOT : PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)) |
| polymer : acceptor |
| LiF (Lithium Fluoride) |
| Al (Aluminum) |

Note: "ITO", "PEDOT : PSS", "polymer : acceptor", "LiF", and "Al" are clearly material names mentioned in the paragraph. "30 nm", "80 nm", and "100 nm" are not material names, but rather the thicknesses of the respective material layers.

Note: ITO and PEDOT : PSS are considered as a single entity as they are described as "ITO/PEDOT : PSS" in the original paragraph. Similarly, LiF and Al are considered as single entities.
